user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of print_perf_warnings:
```c
static void
print_perf_warnings (void)
{
  int newline_needed = 0;
#if defined (_DEBUG)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: Running with debug asserts enabled, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
  newline_needed |=  ! 0;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
#if defined(__GNUC__) && ! defined (__OPTIMIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled without enabled compiler "
           "optimisations, the performance is suboptimal.\n");
  newline_needed |=  ! 0;
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
#if defined(__GNUC__) && defined (__OPTIMIZE_SIZE__)
  fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled with size-optimisations, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
#endif /* __GNUC__ && ! __OPTIMIZE__ */
#if MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701
  if (MHD_NO != MHD_is_feature_supported (MHD_FEATURE_DEBUG_BUILD))
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The libmicrohttpd is compiled with "
             "debug asserts enabled, the performance is suboptimal.\n");
    newline_needed |=  ! 0;
  }
#endif /* MHD_VERSION >= 0x00097701 */
  if (newline_needed)
    printf ("\n");
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled with size-optimisations, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");

fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: The tools is compiled without enabled compiler "
           "optimisations, the performance is suboptimal.\n");

fprintf (stderr, "WARNING: Running with debug asserts enabled, "
           "the performance is suboptimal.\n");
explanation: Rule 17.2 concerns any calls that could (directly or indirectly) invoke the same function. The remaining code fragments are declarations, preprocessor conditionals, simple assignments/bitwise operations (e.g. newline_needed |= ! 0;), and control flow (if, braces). Constants/macros such as MHD_NO and the preprocessor guards are not function calls themselves. No other function-call expressions are present in the provided function, so only the listed call sites need investigation for potential indirect recursion.
